awd_abstract_narration:
The project will support participation of US-based mathematicians, especially those in the early stages of career, in the international conference, "Finite Dimensional Integrable Systems 2022", to be held at the Tel Aviv University, Israel, on June 20-24, 2022. The conference will bring together leading experts in this important and fast growing area of research, along with mathematicians in the early stage of career and graduate students. The conference web site is at http://www.math.tau.ac.il/~ostrover/Workshop/FDIS2022/FDIS2022.html

The conference, "Finite Dimensional Integrable Systems 2022", is focused on integrable systems with a finite number of degrees of freedom, the most classical and popular part of the theory of completely integrable systems that goes back to the works of Lagrange, Jacobi, Kovalevskaya, Noether, Poincare and others. In the second half of 20th century, KAM theory and the work of its founders (Kolmogorov, Arnold, Moser) gave a  new perspective on integrability problems and stimulated further progress in this area. New powerful methods, based on the interplay between a priori disconnected branches of mathematics and physics, have been recently developed:  methods of complex analysis, symplectic and complex geometry, Lie theory, representation theory, and computer algebra - they are all used in the integrability theory. As a result,  new integrable systems have been found, new applications of integrable systems in physics and geometry were discovered, new tools for the study of integrable systems were developed and  many questions, open for a long time, have been answered. The conference will survey recent progress in this field, present open problems, outline new directions of research, look for new applications, and foster new collaborations.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

por.por_cntn:
This grant supported US-based participants of the international workshop "Finite Dimensional Integrable Systems in Geometry and Mathematical Physics" that held in Tel Aviv University in June of 2022. This workshop was 6th in a series: the previous ones held in Jena (2011), Luminy (2013), Bedlevo (2015), Barcelona (2017), and Shanghai (2019).

The workshop was planned for the summer of 2021, but it was postponed by a year due to the pandemic.

The workshop brought together leading experts in the field of integrable systems, along with junior researchers and students, with the aim of exchanging ideas, fostering new collaborations, presenting new results, and providing a learning environment to the participants.

The boader impact of the workshp was in attracting new talent to research in the field of finite dimensional completely integrable systems, helping the junior researchers to create professional networks and familiarize them with the current trends in this research area. The workshop  helped its participants to find new applications of the methods and techniques of this theory in exact sciences.

The workshop included an open problem session that resulted in a multi-authored paper published in "Arnold Mathematical Journal" (this journal published open problems).

The funds were spent toward travel and local expenses of six US-based participants, one of which was a graduate student.

 

 


Last Modified: 06/01/2023
Modified by: Serge L Tabachnikov
